docs.snippet: Those living in the Mesopotamian marshes escape threats posed elsewhere in Iraq by ISIS and militias, but climate change and dam construction threaten their way of life.

headline.main: In the Marshlands, ‘Another Face of Iraq’

docs.snippet: Singapore’s language scene was once “a linguistic tropical rain forest,” chaotic but vibrant. Then came a campaign to limit speech to just English and Mandarin. Now, dialects are coming back.

headline.main: Why France Is Taking a Lesson in Culture From Silicon Valley

headline.main: Laugh and the World Laughs With You. Type ‘Ha,’ Not So Much.

docs.snippet: Lawmakers, executives and other leaders are turning to encrypted chat apps to keep their communications under wraps, causing problems in industries where careful record-keeping is standard procedure.

headline.print_headline: Chat Apps Are Cloaking The Language Of the Powerful

docs.snippet: Yingluck Shinawatra, the former prime minister, is believed to have gone into exile rather than face a possible 10 years in prison on negligence charges.
